content.title: EVAR Complications
content.definition: Major complications: endoleak, migration, limb occlusion, endograft infection, AAA rupture despite repair.
content.statement: EVAR Complications is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Evar that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding EVAR Complications helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of EVAR Complications include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of EVAR Complications.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
